existing_features.title: Create a video content management dashboard where users can view, organize, and track their TikTok video ideas and drafts
Implement user authentication using Internet Identity so each user has their own private collection of video ideas
Add a content calendar view where users can schedule and plan when to post their TikTok videos
Create a hashtag and trend tracker feature where users can save and organize relevant hashtags for their videos

Design a vibrant, modern interface with a creative visual theme inspired by content creation platforms, using energetic colors, clear typography, and engaging layouts that feel dynamic and user-friendly
Add a delete button at the bottom of every video idea card in draft status that allows users to permanently remove the draft from their collection
Add 'made by Zachary j' attribution text at the bottom of the application footer
Add a three-line hamburger menu button at the top right of the Layout component header that opens a dropdown menu
Add a 'Settings' or 'Moderation' option in the dropdown menu that navigates to a new settings page route
Create a basic settings page with a simple interface as the foundation for future moderation features
Add a button labeled 'Staff Access' or similar under the Moderation section on the Settings page that when clicked opens a dialog or modal prompting the user to enter a staff code
Implement staff code verification that checks if the entered code equals '2807' and if correct, unlocks and displays a publish/unpublish toggle control
Add a button in the unlocked staff control that when clicked unpublishes the app and changes to show 'Republish' or similar text, allowing the state to be toggled back and forth

When the app is in unpublished state, display a prominent notice or overlay on all pages (except Settings for staff) informing users that the app is currently closed for maintenance or under moderation
Remove sessionStorage persistence for staff code verification so that staff must enter the code '2807' every time they access the Settings page moderation controls
Update frontend to fetch publication state before any data queries and display UnpublishedOverlay on all pages except Settings when state is unpublished
Fix the republish button functionality so that clicking it successfully changes the backend publication state from unpublished back to published

Add a new visually distinct feature panel in the Settings page staff section (displayed only after staff code verification) that includes a creative staff-only capability such as viewing app analytics, managing user statistics, or accessing moderation logs

Expand the StaffAnalyticsPanel component to display the new metrics in visually distinct card sections including total hashtags, average videos per user, top 5 hashtags list with counts, and recent user activity timeline

new_feature_requests.summary: Add three-line menu button at top right with moderation system (staff code 2807 to close/open app for public)
Add staff code verification (2807) under moderation that unlocks app publish/unpublish toggle button
Create an app publication state management system in the backend that tracks whether the app is published or unpublished, defaulting to published state
Make unpublish functionality actually prevent app access and fix republish button to restore access
Remove any stored staff authentication - require staff code entry every time for moderation access
Implement backend enforcement of publication state where unpublished state blocks all non-admin API calls except getPublicationState
Add additional staff controls or features to the unlocked staff section (creative/surprise element)

If the new staff feature requires backend data (such as user count, video statistics, or activity logs), implement corresponding backend query methods and expose them only to verified staff/admin principals
Expand staff analytics dashboard with additional metrics and visualizations

Add backend query methods to retrieve additional analytics metrics including total hashtags count, average videos per user, most used hashtags (top 5), and recent user activity (last 10 profile creations with timestamps)

Create React Query hooks in useQueries.ts for fetching the new staff analytics data (hashtag stats, user averages, top hashtags, recent activity) that are only called when staff verification is active
